reviewText:
I agree with the previous reviewer, this is a worthwhile set for the Superman aficionado, the super hero lover in your family, but they can't call it, or should not have called it, a BEST OF collection.

to be a "best of" collection, it should contain the best episodes of each series. Yes the first seasons are often the best, but there are key episodes that are better than the rest. H.G.Wells visits to Lois and Clark are among the best, as is the episode where the angel marries them. There are too many other examples.

If you already have all the series, or you have a friend or library from which to borrow them, you might prefer to binge watch each series when you have time, but if you need to have a good introduction to all the televisions series that have focused on Superman in his various incarnations, then this is an excellent way to go.

I was just reading about this collection. If you are a SUPERMAN fan and do not have all of these Super shows on DVD...or you want one box set that fills your super need this is for you This collection materials that have all been released before, placed in one collection. 30 Disks this is a SUPERFAN collection Disc Case 1: Smallville - The Complete 1st Season (6 discs) Superman Serials: The Complete 1948 & 1950 Collection (4 discs) (that is Superman & Atom Man vs Superman, both starring Kirk Alynas Superman) Disc Case 2: Lois & Clark: The New Adventures of Superman - The Complete 1st Season (6 discs) Superman: The Animated Series - Volume 1 (2 discs) The New Adventures of Superman [1966 animated] (2 discs) This is the Filmamtion Superman) Disc Case 3: Adventures of Superman - The Complete 1st Season [1952 George Reeves] (5 discs) DC Universe Superman Doomsday Direct-to-DVD Movie (1 disc) Max Fleischer's Superman: 1941-1942 (2 discs) Superman - 13 Heroic Ruby-Spears Episodes (2 discs) What should be in this collection and is not is All-Star Superman,The Look, Up in the Sky!: Amazing Story of Superman,Superman/Batman: Public Enemies and Superboy - The Complete First Season, This would have made this super collection complete. On the whole it is a fan-boys Superman DVD dream. worth it at any price One would hope when 20th Century Fox and Warner Brothers arrange an agreement,so Batman the TV show (yes that Adam West show) would be released to DVD..then they can do a BATMAN box like this Bennet Pomerantz AUDIOWORLD
